etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in Curtis's Botanical Magazine. From post-classical Latin capitellatus, either from capitellum (although this is apparently first attested later in botanical use) + classical Latin -ātus, or an alteration of capitulatus (in botany) terminating in a small knob, after -ellum

definitions: Of a long narrow part, especially a stigma: terminating in a small knob.
